sections.heading: Decree; appeals.(1) A decree dissolving a marriage becomes final and operative, except for the purpose of review by appeal, at the time specified in section 42-372
sections.text: 01.(2) For the purpose of review by appeal, the decree shall be treated as a final order as soon as it is entered. If an appeal is insti

sections.heading: 372, R.R.S.1943, Reissue 1978, allows a modification within the six months before the decree is final to provide for alimony where none was awarded in the final decree
